intro: Staurophragma natolicum var. davisianum, commonly known as the Davis's starry bell, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, contributing to local biodiversity.
